article.title: cloning
article.text:
Cloning is the act of making a clone of a [[Zite]]. 

This can be achieved by going to [[ZeroHello]] ([[ZeroNet]]'s home page, and your home page), hovering over the site you want to clone, clicking on the 3 dots at the right and selecting "<tt>clone</tt>".

Most users get familiar with this when they first clone [http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit ZeroBlog], a [[ZeroNet]] powered blog.

==Enable cloning on your [[zite]]==

You may have noticed the "<tt>clone</tt>" option is not there for every website. The website owner has to enable this in the site's [[content.json]] by setting the boolean "<tt>cloneable</tt>" to "<tt>true</tt>", then [[signing]] and [[publishing]] it.

==\*-default files==

Files with <tt>-default</tt> suffix will be copied instead of their equivalent without this suffix. For example, if their are both a <tt>data</tt> and a <tt>data-default</tt> directory in the zite, only the <tt>data-default</tt> will be copied. It's commonly used to avoid having a lot of useless data being copied, like articles in [http://127.0.0.1:43110/Blog.ZeroNetwork.bit ZeroBlog].
